Clearly understanding the characteristics of sin and merit is being a wise person.
Not having right understanding of this is the work of a fool.
Well understanding all merits, and also faults,
Truly knowing these two kinds always obtains a share of happiness.
If a person commits various sins, it is like being with an enemy.
One who delights in practicing goodness is like being close to a good friend.ğŸ”½Because of attachment, one creates and the objects always appear before one.
Transmigrating in the midst of delusion, one always experiences various sufferings.
The objects of desire are like a dense forest, and craving always dwells there.
Foolish people do not understand the Dharma, so by what means can they escape?
Falling into that hell, they unite and experience various sufferings.
You should know that without committing offenses, there is no way to come here.
Practicing goodness brings supreme rewards, adorned with immeasurable blessings.
Doing evil brings misfortune upon oneself, and one is definitely unable to escape.
It is said that one's own suffering and happiness cycle in the ocean of the three realms,
Blown by the wind of karma, like waves on water.
If a person is born in a state of ease, they always create all kinds of evil.
For this reason, they will fall into hell.
If they escape from hell, they are reborn in other destinies,
And are again led by desire, forgetting the suffering they have experienced.
This mind, due to habitual tendencies, momentarily awakens and then becomes deluded again,
When happiness ends, suffering is born again, not thinking of future calamities.
Deceived by the five faculties, one goes mad and invades others' realms,
Experiencing endless transmigration, all due to being bound by craving.
Falling into the hells, ghost realms, animal realms, and barbarian lands,
Or briefly being born in the heavens, quickly falling back into misfortune.
Experiencing the transmigration of various realms, like a wheel in the world,
All due to the pulling of karmic habits, yet not giving rise to weariness.
Even if one is born in the heavens, experiencing the most wonderful bliss,
When merit is exhausted, one falls back again - all of this is the practice of samsara.
Falling into the lotus hell, hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of times,
Experiencing immeasurable suffering and distress, foolishly without fear or loathing.
The three realms have no joy, all are oppressed by suffering,
Sentient beings are blinded by delusion, never harboring worry or fear.
Foolish people are confused by the causes of suffering, unable to understand suffering,
This suffering arises from causes, like a seed producing its fruit.
Bound by suffering and joy, going back and forth in the three existences,
Except for the bliss of tranquility, forever free from all worries and afflictions.
If one is able to contemplate the sufferings in all places of birth,
These sufferings will not arise again, and one will attain peace by leaving behind suffering.
If a person can recall the sufferings and afflictions in the hells,
Then in those pleasures, they will not be attached to even a small part.
Having understood in this way that the world is all false and deceptive,
One should leave behind all faults and skillfully cultivate with wisdom.
Life does not last long, it passes in the blink of an eye,
Cut off those causes of evil and always practice all that is good.
Understanding that life is not solid, all is created by the mind,
Relying on right conduct in what one does, not seeking a wrong livelihood,
Why do you not give rise to fear of the sufferings and afflictions of the future?
The rope of delusion constantly binds and encircles, the fires of hell always burn and cook.
Delusion is an unwholesome dharma, contrary to pure and meritorious karma,
Able to lead evil beings, for a long time sinking in the sea of suffering.
If a person is not afraid of sin, and delights in creating many evils,
They will go from one hell to another, to be burned by the fires of hell.
Just as a single tiny fire can burn up all things,
A fool's sins, however slight, will also cause him to fall into hell.
If a person is afraid of evil paths, and does not commit any sinful acts,
They will be able to embrace the true Dharma, abandon evil and follow goodness.
Evil friends give rise to negligence, and create shamelessness and lack of conscience,
The wise always stay far away from them, as they are like fire and poison.
The Dharma of suffering is an obstacle of Mara, the Dharma of joy is unobstructed,
In the two, skillfully discriminating, all is thoroughly penetrated.
Stay far away from those evil friends, delight in widely practicing giving and patience,
Compassion for all sentient beings is the essential practice for being reborn in the heavens.
If a person makes a living through evil means and commits various evil deeds,
I will now explain their retribution, which will later lead to falling into hell.
Namely, the hells of Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, KÄlasÅ«tra, Saá¹ƒghÄta, two MahÄjvÄla,
Tapana, PratÄpana, and AvÄ«ci;
These eight hells each have a gate on each side,
And each gate of the hells is a city for the four hells;
Iron cities surround everywhere, filled with those who have done evil.
The jailers impale the sinners like fish being cooked in a cauldron,
Raining mountains, rocks, and weapons, chopping and smashing their bodies.
Day and night they always wail and cry, and are made to drink molten copper when thirsty;
Being tormented by extreme suffering, they let out loud cries,
Experiencing various punishments, fleeing in all four directions.
If a person is covered by delusion, they give rise to various evil views perversely,
Inviting the causes of hell, like the deep and vast ocean.
This inferior evil view harms oneself and others,
The causes and conditions of immeasurable suffering, you bind yourself.
Because of attachment to wrong views, relying on oneself, one gives rise to arrogance,
Forever falling into evil paths, for a long time one experiences extreme suffering.
Because of creating that evil karma, you now come to this place,
Inferior and foolish person, what do you fear that you created yourself?
Creating evil and hoping for good rewards, there is no such place,
Planting in the deep abyss, there will certainly be no beneficial fruits.
If a person indulges in delusion and often associates with harmony,
For the sake of a little pleasure, later one experiences much suffering.
Foolish people falsely take pleasure, longing and attaching to wives and children,
Arising from defiled afflictions, all due to the deluded mind of craving;
At the time of one's own death, there is not a single one who can rescue and protect,
Alone one goes to the perilous and evil path, miserable and long gone.
Moreover, in that hell, originally there are no various instruments of suffering,
Following the evil-doers, it is the transformation of their own minds.
It is like burning wonderful incense, suddenly drifting without direction,
Also like a flock of birds roosting at night, gathering in the morning and dispersing at dawn.
Either robbing others of their wealth, or harming their lives,
Committing this extremely unwholesome, all due to being caused by delusion.
That is to say, due to delusion, one enters from darkness into darkness,
Losing the right practice for rebirth in the heavens, as well as the supreme tranquility.
Those wives, children, and relatives, bound tightly, difficult to escape,
Drowning in the ocean of birth and death, without any reliance or protection.
Greedily seeking to create various evils, all for the sake of wife and children,
And oneself experiencing bitter suffering, what do they each know?
In countless lives, always greedily attached to beautiful forms,
Because of this, creating various faults, inferior and without shame.
First creating those sinful evils, later not giving rise to regret,
Certainly falling into the hells, for long eons without a chance of escape.
Although relatives are numerous, what can they do to save oneself?
Seeing others who are attached to desires, receiving retribution is also like this.
Practicing good conduct oneself, will certainly attract its pleasant fruits,
Foolish people are obscured by delusion, with regard to this they are utterly without understanding.
If covered by delusion, greed and anger also arise accordingly,
What is loved belongs to others, one's own suffering is unable to be avoided.
Internally burned by the three poisons, externally surrounded by the fires of the hells,
Suffering for a long eon, when will they escape the evil paths?
Creating all kinds of evil with their own minds, they never feel shame or remorse,
Only to be burned by the fires of hellâ€”what use are their futile laments?
You are extremely dull-witted, delighting in practicing what is contrary to the Dharma,
You need not give rise to regret and remorse, but should endure the suffering with patience.
Foolish people create many offenses, and upon doing so, give rise to fear and terror,
Karmic consequences always follow, all arising from causes and conditions.
How have they ever cultivated goodness, yet are unable to cut off evil?
If one can abandon evil, then they will never see hell.
If a person is covered by delusion, they do not understand the consequences of karma,
Mistaken by false teachers, their faults and transgressions increase.
Because of fear of the offenses they have previously created, they constantly give rise to distress and anxiety,
Without the correct Dharma as an antidote, they will ultimately be tormented by suffering.
If one can avoid all faults, then one will not have a share in suffering.
Abiding in right mindfulness and contemplation, one should not commit any offenses.
If one delights in creating various evils, then one will have no aversion to suffering.
Adding suffering to suffering, by what means can one escape?
If the mind does not give rise to aversion, then how can there be tranquility?
Therefore, I do not give rise to compassion for those sentient beings who commit offenses.
You are bound by delusion and create those unwholesome actions.
Those causes are created by yourself, and I cannot save you.
Accumulating those deluded actions, evil and wrongdoing fill up.
If one cannot uphold pure precepts, who can escape the painful retribution?
If a person creates evil karma, then according to the causes, one will receive the retribution.
One should know that the causes and conditions of suffering are created by oneself and experienced by oneself.
You are bound by the rope of craving, frenzied and shameless,
They undergo extremely harsh punishments, the suffering of which cannot be described.
If a person commits many evil deeds, they will experience various kinds of severe pain.
If not done, they will not be experienced; without causes, there are no results.
Such various afflictions, their fruits are in the hells.
Never giving rise to joy in the various wholesome dharmas,
Not cultivating meritorious deeds, creating immeasurable evil,
Experiencing retribution in the same way, foolish people merely regret and distress themselves.
Abandoning all good people, engaging in much deceit and fraud,
Not cultivating true causes, seeking happiness cannot be attained.
Accumulating various sinful defilements, arising from an ignorant mind,
For long eons experiencing extreme suffering, all due to what was created in the past.
The sentient beings in the hells are imprisoned by the wardens,
Severely reprimanded, When your karma is exhausted, you will be released.
Moreover, those foolish people are deceived by their own minds,
Not understanding the karma they have created, they grieve with vexation;
Taking what is not beneficial as good, regarding good friends as enemies,
Harming themselves and others, they always dwell in great darkness.
Those three poisons and evil deeds are no different from deep enmity,
They can drag sentient beings to Yama's abode.
From what cause does this delusion arise?
It is all due to clinging to the notion of mine.
Not cultivating the practices of giving and so forth, by what means can one be liberated?
Sin is the foremost enemy, following one to the evil destinies,
In this life and the next, it does not abandon one;
The evil deeds one has created are like sharp knives and poisonous fires,
Extremely dangerous and terrifying, you will have to experience them after you have created them.
If one's mind is tranquil and not attached to sense objects,
Not following the practice of delusion, one will be free from evil retribution.
Hearing the sounds of suffering in hell, the ignorant do not give rise to fear,
Like holding dry firewood, throwing it into a raging fire.
Moreover, the fire of the world, if burning for a long time, can be extinguished,
One should know that the fire of karma is long-lasting and blazing;
The power of ordinary fire can be extinguished, but the fire of karma continues for a long time,
If a person commits evil deeds, they will be burned in the end.
Therefore, the fire of karma always burns the people of hell,
Those who are not afraid of the evil paths will not be able to escape this harm.
With wisdom, one should make distinctions and protect oneself well,
Far away from evil karma, one will not experience any suffering.
Covered by delusion, one always creates all kinds of evil,
Now experiencing this extreme suffering, crying out in grief is of no use.
And the end of suffering,ğŸ”½The causes of suffering and the fruits of suffering,
Are all unlovable.ğŸ”½In the past, in the human realm,
You widely created various evil karma,ğŸ”½Inviting this dangerous and evil retribution,
Which you will now have to experience yourself.ğŸ”½Free from inverted discrimination,
Causes and effects are always in accord,ğŸ”½As with what you have done in the past,
You will receive retribution according to your karma.ğŸ”½If you can always cherish
Your own body,ğŸ”½How can you commit the act of killing
And wait to end another's life?ğŸ”½If you seek their wealth and profit,
You will endure all kinds of hardships,ğŸ”½How can you have the intention to rob
And steal others' wealth?ğŸ”½If you are devoted to guarding
Your own wife and concubines,ğŸ”½How can you give rise to invasion and violence
Towards others' spouses?ğŸ”½If you commit the sin of lying
And deceive the good and virtuous,
For others to disbelieve and accept, their tongues are extremely terrifying.
You enjoy the sin of drinking alcohol, which leads to the arising of stupidity,
Inviting illegal slander, why not give rise to far-reaching avoidance?
These five kinds of evil, all of which you have previously created,
Now experiencing this evil retribution, why lament in vain?
Unsuitable dharmas are like poison, you should always avoid them,
Causing all sentient beings to long drown in the sea of suffering.
Moreover, the fire of that craving and desire blazes in the three existences,
Seeing good benefits but not cultivating them, what happiness can be obtained later?
Speaking skillful smiles and words increases craving and desire,
This is a great fault, it should be cut off without remainder.
Having fallen into that hell, one cries out in great lamentation,
The jailers all say:
As one receives according to one's causes.
Not far from all evils, having done them, one does them again,
The causes then increase, and the retribution received is like this.
If one fears the suffering of the future, one should cultivate various good deeds in the present,
Then there will be no retribution in hell, and one will not give rise to lamentation.
Carelessness is like that ground, giving birth to all that is unwholesome,
Immeasurable sentient beings are all dragged along by greed.
You have formerly committed many offenses, giving rise to the evil conduct of greed and so forth,
Foolish people do not understand that when suffering comes, who can take it away for them?
Not giving rise to a compassionate mind, following along with all evils, one transmigrates,
In the boundless sea of suffering, relying on what can one be saved?
Wealth and what is cherished, at the end of life all is abandoned,
Because of committing these many offenses, one is pursued by the wardens of hell.
Extremely fierce and evil fires, filling the entire sky,
Blazing flames without interval.
The suffering is unbearable to behold, in terror, where can one go?
Blades form its path, driving one to tread upon it.
The dangers and difficulties are vast like the ocean, going alone without a companion,
When can one attain liberation? Who can save me?
I am oppressed by suffering, exhausted and unable to proceed,
Seized and bound, dragged and taken away;ğŸ”½Wife, children, friends and relatives,
Arriving here, all become like enemies.
Even with immeasurable wealth and treasures, seeking help cannot bring liberation.
Due to past indulgence, happiness turns into suffering,
Dragged by the noose of death, in the darkness, where can one go?ğŸ”½The Yama hell wardens,
Extremely violent and wrathful,
Seize and bind, adding humiliation, the mind gives rise to great terror.
I observe that evil place, with various painful punishments,
All sentient beings and non-sentient beings, all ablaze with fierce flames.
There are also great poisonous pythons, surrounding everywhere,
Crying out in grief, seeking to escape, with no refuge and no savior.
Falling into the dark prison, deep and vast like the great ocean,
For eons, how can one see the light of the stars and planets in the sky?
It is said that because of the five sense faculties, one gives rise to inverted attachment,
Transmigrating in the three realms of existence, how can one attain tranquility?
All the limbs and parts of the body are cut apart by sharp saws,
With immeasurable extreme suffering, words cannot fully express it.
Accumulating sins like mountains, suffering always surrounding,
Increasing moment by moment, the mind creates and the body experiences itself.
Experiencing extreme suffering and distress, the bitterness is known only to oneself,
Yama will order them, saying:
Look at what you have done in the past.
If you understand your own offenses, you will be able to endure suffering,
And will contemplate each one until your karma is exhausted.
In the past, you were covered by delusion, and now you foolishly give rise to regret and distress.
You created such causes, and now you will experience such effects.
Due to the arising of evil thoughts, you committed grave offenses of increasing severity,
Falling into the most difficult and dangerous difficulties, experiencing the most intense suffering among sufferings.
Foolish people commit offenses, like throwing firewood into a fire,
From one eon to the next eon, they may escape when their karma is exhausted.
Neither the gods, asuras, yakshas, ghosts, or spirits,
Can rescue me when I am seized by the noose of death.
Bound by that rope, they will be dragged to Yama's abode,
Terrified, without any refuge, going wherever their karma leads them.
If one is free from the faults of desire, the most excellent in the three realms,
Liberated from all bonds, one will not create any offenses.
If the causes and conditions of union are first obtained from the father,
He has toiled in this way, why do you commit murder?
Moreover, the offense of killing one's mother, evil karma has no transgression of this,
Falling into the hells, one receives the supreme and extreme suffering.
Cutting off the bonds of the three existences, this is called an arhat,
Foolishly committing murder, now receiving this painful retribution.
The treasury of all dharmas, revealing the gate of liberation,
You destroy the harmonious Sangha, now receiving this painful retribution.
Always speaking false words, pointing east while speaking of the north,
What is said lacks sincerity, now receiving this painful retribution.
Moreover, giving rise to frivolous speech, damaging true treasures,
Neither benefiting oneself nor others, one now receives this painful retribution.
Engaging in the evil karma of divisive speech, slandering each other,
Causing separation among close friends, one now receives this painful retribution.
Speaking meaningless evil words, like knives, sticks, poison, or fire,
Causing others to experience distress, one now receives this painful retribution.
Protecting and cherishing one's own life, harming all sentient beings,
Always lacking a compassionate mind, one now receives this painful retribution.
The precious wealth possessed by others, stealing or robbing,
Indulging in the causes of the five desires, one now receives this painful retribution.
Delighting in engaging in sexual misconduct, like adding fuel to a fire,
Always giving rise to a fearful mind, increasing all that is unwholesome;
Delighting in clinging to wrong views, damaging the wholesome roots of others,
Receiving evil retribution without end, experiencing the utmost suffering and distress.
These various evil realms, you foolishly follow and turn,
All due to the corresponding actions of body, speech, and mind.
Having committed those various evils, when death arrives, suffering appears before you,
Driven by the wardens of hell, you quickly go to the hells.
The suffering and distress of hell is extremely difficult to endure,
Even if the ocean is deep and vast, it will burn and dry up.
If a person understands that evil causes and effects are not enjoyable,
He should always contemplate correctly and should not commit offenses.
The treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, with all virtues complete,
Having been born among humans, why not draw near?
First committing subtle offenses, like being burned by a small fire,
Later extensively creating evil causes, like throwing oneself into a fire pit.
Fearing and worrying about offenses, the mind does not cease creating evil,
Constantly thinking of the suffering to be experienced, what are you doing now?
Know that even a small offense can give rise to much suffering,
When the karma is exhausted, one will be released from it, and there is no other way to be saved.
The messengers of Yama examine and release them,
If the evil retribution has not yet been exhausted, they will be dragged back to experience various sufferings.
In the limbs and extremities of the body, they will be split and cut apart,
The countless sinful beings will cry out in grief and sorrow.
There are also evil beings who often engage in divisive speech,
Just like a single seed that later grows into countless [fruits].
All due to their evil wisdom, they give rise to disputes and chaos,
Towards relatives and friends, they all cause destruction.
Always staying away from good words, they enjoy speaking evil words,
They will have their tongues cut off, cause and effect are similar.
Hundreds of thousands of merits and virtues are destroyed by the tongue,
Now experiencing this painful retribution, when will they be liberated?
Falling into that hell, extremely hot, giving rise to hunger and thirst,
Like throwing mustard seeds into a mass of fire on Mount Sumeru.
Moreover, the fire of that hell is also born from hunger and thirst,
And those falling gods also receive retribution in the same way.
The various evil karmas created are all born from the three poisons,
Turning and turning in the midst of raging flames, with no place to hide or escape.
Ignorant sentient beings mistakenly give rise to discrimination,
Speaking unwholesomely as wholesome, treating good friends as enemies.
How is it that sentient beings do not realize the true Dharma?
Even if it is revealed to them, their minds do not give rise to joy.
Not delighting in hearing the true Dharma, slandering the Dharma teacher,
In this defiled and evil world, how can one give rise to the eye of wisdom?
The realm of foolish people is long deluded by desire and lust.
Not relying on the true Dharma and Vinaya, there is no cause for self-enlightenment;
Dragged by the rope of delusion, they always enjoy doing evil,
And after doing so, they experience extreme suffering, giving rise to regret in vain.
Due to excessive delusion, they call non-dharma the Dharma,
And since their causes are inverted, they err in practice and study in confusion;
Lacking the discernment of wisdom, they indulge in the five desires,
And do not cultivate goodness, but see evil and follow in doing it.
The minds of the gods are attached to pleasure, and they fall into the fire of negligence.
Not encountering superior wholesome conditions, they then follow in decline and fall.
Moreover, those foolish people hate and envy the virtuous and good,
Feigning various dignified behaviors, they deceive others and seek gain.
Although one may speak the true Dharma with the mouth, the mind always seeks others' faults,
This person in the world is the worst of the worst.
If a person is attached to sensual pleasures, he is seeking suffering and distress,
Deceived by his own mind, the suffering of the destruction of pleasure is not experienced by others.
Therefore, with right wisdom, one should always cultivate the ten wholesome actions,
And completely eradicate all that is unbeneficial.
Taking joy in benefiting others, one should keep the mind focused without momentary abandonment,
Always relying on pure wholesome dharmas, one should abide in this way.
If a person does not practice giving, it is like seeking light without a lamp,
Abandoning wholesome actions, how can there be pleasant karmic results?
Just as a blind person in the world sees nothing,
Apart from giving, there is no cause for blessings, one will fall into the realm of hungry ghosts.
Falling into the realm of hungry ghosts without wealth, one wanders around seeking,
Always suffering from hunger and thirst, all due to the effects of stinginess.
If one delights in practicing generosity, all will be unable to destroy it,
Not creating even a little cause, later one will only give rise to regret.
Due to previously creating evil karma, one falls into the realm of hungry ghosts,
Being burned by the fires of hell, for a long time experiencing the suffering of hunger and thirst;
When will one leave that realm and temporarily attain happiness?
In what eon will one attain liberation and then abandon all afflictions?
Due to not understanding cause and effect, and the path and what is not the path,
Being tormented by the fire of hunger, suffering continues without end.
With an ugly appearance, disheveled hair, and only sinews and skin connected,
Desiring various foods and drinks, temporarily seeing them is impossible to obtain.
Being oppressed by various sufferings, one falls into all kinds of evil and danger,
Never having any relatives or friends who can temporarily rescue me.
In the past, among humans, you cut off the practice of creating merit,
Like going to an island of treasures, returning empty-handed and alone.
If you enjoy cultivating excellent practices, always stay away from those evils,
I observe those good people, stepping on the steps to rebirth in the heavens.
Due to the body, speech, and mind creating various unwholesome actions,
Relatives all go elsewhere, alone relying on suffering to abide.
The messengers of Yama seize and drive them away,
Entering deep, dark obscurity, the distance is extremely far.
In all places, I constantly experience various sufferings,
Not even a trace of joy for a moment.
Now experiencing this retribution, all due to what was done before,
When will I escape this suffering and reach a place of happiness?
Because of being tormented by thirst, in vain I climb that high plain,
Even if they see rivers or ponds, they dry up upon reaching them.
In the vast wilderness, mountains, and forests, they search everywhere,
Suffering from thirst and hunger, they cannot find water.
Even where there is moisture, they cannot see it,
And there are also large crows and vultures, pecking with their sharp beaks.
The fires of hunger and thirst always torment their bodies,
Rolling in dangerous paths, they cry out for rescue and protection.
In the past, they were close to sensual objects, which are like reflections in a mirror,
Empty and false, they squandered their own precious wealth, and now they alone receive this retribution.
Because of creating that karma, they are trapped and difficult to escape,
Running in the four directions, they will be liberated when their karma is exhausted.
Born from the three poisons, the extremely evil and fierce fire
Blazes constantly, moment by moment, and can burn even huge rocks.
Moreover, fire can burn stones, and water can extinguish them,
But the fire of my karma is like an ocean - how can it be extinguished?
Evil karma is like fuel, and the wind of craving ignites it,
Burning those sentient beings in the hells, with no escape in any direction.
I have committed various offenses and stayed far away from wholesome dharmas,
Falling into the realm of hungry ghosts, deceived by my own mind.
I am tormented by the two fires of hunger and thirst,
And wounded by knives and sticks, experiencing three kinds of extreme suffering.
I have created evil karma and fallen into the realm of hungry ghosts,
Neither my relatives nor friends can rescue me.
Only those wholesome dharmas can be my refuge,
Namely, generosity, morality, and much learning - these three are my rescue.
Even if I create extremely evil and painful causes,
Falling into the net of delusion, they will long drown in the sea of suffering.
Experiencing extremely heavy heat and distress, it is truly difficult to bear,
If I can escape from this, I will not commit even the slightest offense again.
In that realm of hungry ghosts, they always give rise to great sorrow and fear,
Because of these unwholesome causes, one should therefore stay far away from them.
The suffering retribution of the animal realm is being bound and beaten,
If one does not stop the causes and conditions of killing, one will be reborn to be eaten again.
The deluded person's mind is confused by love and attachment, delighting in harming others,
Not cultivating the causes of generosity and precepts, one will later receive the retribution of being an animal.
Bound by the rope of love and attachment, the five faculties are like a fool or mute,
Nursing resentment, hatred, and jealousy, one will later receive the retribution of being an animal;
What should be done and what should not be done, what can be eaten and what cannot be eaten,
Regarding wholesome and unwholesome dharmas, one is completely unable to understand.
In the human realm, there is much pursuit, and the gods are attached to indulgence,
Hungry ghosts experience hunger and thirst, and hell is only extreme suffering.
If a person delights in killing sentient beings,
It will bring forth various dangerous sufferings, and they will harm each other.
Moreover, all beings are often stingy and distracted,
For this reason, they will fall into the realms of ghosts and animals.
The faults of those three poisons submerge all sentient beings,
Experiencing the cycle of birth and death, it is difficult to escape from the deep abyss.
If one delights in seeking the true Dharma, then various wholesome fruits will arise,
Endowed with that bright wisdom, one will be respected by others.
Therefore, the wise one delights in cultivating pure karma,
Contemplating in accordance with principle, one will ascend the correct path of liberation.
Delighting in doing what is not beneficial, driving and controlling all beings,
Inviting inferior suffering causes, there is none like hunger.
Crying out for food and drink, the fire arises from one's own body,
Burning those sinful beings, like burning dry wood.
This fire pervades all places, following wherever it reaches,
Even if one passes through a hundred kalpas, without food there is no way to save.
Although worldly fire is hot, the fire of hunger surpasses this,
Rushing through the three existences, seeking food without obtaining it.
Moreover, sentient beings in the world always give rise to various faults,
For the sake of food and drink, they sink and drown in the ocean of the three existences.
Dwelling in the three existences, pulled along by karma,
For a long time experiencing painful torment, this suffering is said to be endless.
Dwelling in the womb, submerged in filth,
Experiencing oppressive heat and distress, this suffering is said to be endless.
Indulging in objects of desire, delighting in exquisite adornments,
Greedy for seeking and enduring hardships, this suffering is said to be endless.
Always going to others' homes, seeking clothing and food,
Being despised by them, this suffering is said to be endless.
Driven by the poison of love, exhausting oneself in search,
Until the body is no more, this suffering is said to be endless.
Greedy for one's own objects of desire, many enemies watch for an opportunity,
The mind is always filled with fear, this suffering is said to be endless.
Because of one's wife and children, much worry and sorrow arise,
This is the greatest enemy, this suffering is said to be endless.
Pointlessly wasting precious wealth, being scolded and criticized by relatives and friends,
Because of this, anxiety arises, this suffering is said to be endless.
The body changes and decays with old age, leaning on a cane and walking slowly,
Physical strength suddenly becomes weak and emaciated, this suffering is said to be endless.
What one has loved and cherished in life, at the time of death, all is abandoned,
Going alone, with no one to rely on, this suffering is said to be endless.
Foolish people commit various crimes, falling into the evil destinies,
All due to the causes of food and drink, this is what the wise admonish;
Understanding that this is the result of karma, one should give rise to fear in the mind,
